subject: Sleep
title: How Whales Sleep
description: A fast breakdown of How Whales Sleep for builders.

hook.text: Sperm whales sleep vertically, bobbing like enormous buoys just below the ocean surface. It's one of nature's strangest sights.

buildup.text: Whales, like dolphins, use unihemispheric sleep but also enter short periods of full bilateral sleep.

discovery.text: Sperm whales sleep only about seven percent of the day, among the shortest of any mammal.

twist.text: During full sleep, they drift motionless in the water. Researchers have accidentally bumped sleeping whale pods with boats.

climax.text: Newborn whale calves and their mothers don't sleep at all for weeks after birth to avoid predation during migration.

punchline.text: The largest animals on Earth survive on some of the least sleep.

quiz.question: How do sperm whales position themselves while sleeping?
options: They lie flat on the ocean floor
They float vertically just below the surface
